summary: This is an email chain from March 2016 involving attorney Peter Skinner forwarding a Page Six article about Jeffrey Epstein's continued relationships with young women to a U.S. Attorney's Office contact. The email references legal documents and introduces attorney Sigrid McCawley as a lead on the case.

persons.name: Peter Skinner
persons.context: Attorney sending emails to the U.S. Attorney's Office, forwarding a news article and attaching legal documents related to cases against Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: Introduced as one of the lead attorneys on the case involving Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, with knowledge of the facts.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of a defamation case; her motion to dismiss was denied by Judge Sweet.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in a forwarded Page Six article reporting on his continued relationships with young women.

persons.name: Judge Sweet
persons.context: Judge who denied Ghislaine Maxwell's motion to dismiss in the defamation case.

connections.description: Skinner introduces McCawley as a lead attorney on the case and includes her in the email chain.
McCawley is a lead attorney on a case against Maxwell, as indicated by the referenced defamation case.
Maxwell is referenced in the context of legal cases related to Epstein, implying their association.
Skinner is communicating with and providing documents to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Page Six Article on Epstein
events.description: Page Six reports on Jeffrey Epstein's continued relationships with young women, mentioning his East Side mansion housing Russian playmates.

events.title: Meeting with U.S. Attorney's Office
events.description: Peter Skinner and colleagues met with the U.S. Attorney's Office to discuss the case, followed by an email with attached legal documents.

events.title: Maxwell's Motion to Dismiss Denied
events.description: Judge Sweet denies Ghislaine Maxwell's motion to dismiss in the defamation case against her.

keyFacts: In March 2016, a Page Six article reported on Jeffrey Epstein's continued relationships with young women, suggesting ongoing activity.
Attorney Peter Skinner was communicating with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, providing legal documents related to cases against Ghislaine Maxwell.
Sigrid McCawley is identified as a lead attorney on the case with knowledge of the facts, indicating her central role in the legal proceedings.
A defamation case against Ghislaine Maxwell was active, with Judge Sweet denying her motion to dismiss on February 29, 2016.
The email references attached documents including a complaint, declarations, a Rule 56.1 statement, and a redacted FBI 302 form, showing the sharing of evidence with prosecutors.
